compliance_reasoning: The regulation applies to this document as it is a financial product document from a regulated entity (AIB life) that contains technical terms related to pension schemes. The document complies with the regulation by including a dedicated 'DEFINITIONS' section (Section 1) that explains all technical terms used throughout the document in plain language. Each technical term is clearly marked in bold throughout the document and is defined in this glossary-style section when first introduced.
compliance_evidence:
SECTION 1
DEFINITIONS
This section defines some of the words and phrases we use in this document. These words and phrases are shown in bold and listed below together with an explanation of their meanings in relation to the rules. Words in the singular also include the plural and vice versa.
regulation_text: 47. A regulated entity shall ensure that all information that it provides to a consumer explains any technical terms, the use of which cannot be avoided, in plain language, where first used or in a clearly referenced glossary.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
compliance_evidence_with_page:
